intro: Cyphomattia lanata, commonly known as the woolly cyphomattia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woolly stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Cyphomattia lanata is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments.
